Key Match Events: The Knicks lost to the Rockets, 109-97.
Karl-Anthony Towns scored 17 points on 7-for-17 shooting with zero 3-pointers.
The Knicks were outscored by 26 points during Towns' 32 minutes on the court.
Josh Hart finished with 12 points and seven assists in 38 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart emphasized the need for more ball movement and less focus on mismatches.
Coach Tom Thibodeau was clearly peeved by the officiating in his postgame interviews.
Karl-Anthony Towns expressed that he would be prepared for whatever the defense and opponent's game plan is in future games.
Jalen Brunson agreed with Hart that the Knicks were too consumed with hunting mismatches and suggested finding something they are good at and sticking with it.
Karl-Anthony Towns mentioned that the game provided good film to watch early in the season and that it was an expensive lesson.
